t: Isaiah 29
The Siege of Jerusalem
Ah,*pn Ariel, Ariel, the*ld city where David encamped! Add*ln year to year; let*ld the feasts run their round.
Yet*ln I will distress Ariel, and*ld there shall be moaning and lamentation, and*ld she shall be to me like an Ariel.
And*ln I will encamp against you all around, and*ld will besiege you with towers and*ld I will raise siegeworks against you.

And*ln you will be brought low; from the earth you shall speak, and*ld from the dust your speech will be bowed down; your*ln voice shall come from the ground like the voice of a ghost, and*ld from the dust your speech shall whisper.
But*pn the multitude of your foreign foes shall be like small dust, and*ld the multitude of the ruthless like passing chaff. And*ln in an instant, suddenly,
you*ld will be visited by the Lord*s of hosts with*ln thunder and with earthquake and great noise, with*ld whirlwind and tempest, and the flame of a devouring fire.
And*ln the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, all*ld that fight against her and her stronghold and distress her, shall*ld be like a dream, a vision of the night.

As*ln when a hungry man dreams, and behold, he is eating, and*ld awakes with his hunger not satisfied, or*ln as when a thirsty man dreams, and behold, he is drinking, and*ld awakes faint, with his thirst not quenched, so*ln shall the multitude of all the nations be that*ld fight against Mount Zion.
Astonish*pn yourselves and be astonished; blind*ld yourselves and be blind! Be*ln drunk, but not with wine; stagger,*ld but not with strong drink!
For*ln the Lord*s has poured out upon you a*ld spirit of deep sleep, and*ln has closed your eyes (the prophets), and*ld covered your heads (the seers).
And*p the vision of all this has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed. When men give it to one who can read, saying, “Read this,” he says, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
And when they give the book to one who cannot read, saying, “Read this,” he says, “I cannot read.”

And*pn the Lord said: “Because*ln this people draw near with their mouth and*ld honor me with their lips, while*ld their hearts are far from me, and*ln their fear of me is a commandment taught by men,

therefore,*ln behold, I will again do*ld wonderful things with this people, with*ld wonder upon wonder; and*ln the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and*ld the discernment of their discerning men shall be hidden.”
Ah,*pn you who hide deep from the Lord*s your counsel, whose*ld deeds are in the dark, and*ld who say, “Who sees us? Who knows us?”

You*ln turn things upside down! Shall*ln the potter be regarded as the clay, that*ln the thing made should say of its maker, “He*ld did not make me”; or*ln the thing formed say of him who formed it, “He*ld has no understanding”?
Is*pn it not yet a very little while until*ld Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and*ld the fruitful field shall be regarded as a forest?
In*ln that day the deaf shall hear the*ld words of a book, and*ln out of their gloom and darkness the*ld eyes of the blind shall see.
The*ln meek shall obtain fresh joy in the Lord,*s and*ld the poor among mankind shall exult in the Holy One of Israel.
For*ln the ruthless shall come to nothing and*ld the scoffer cease, and*ld all who watch to do evil shall be cut off,
who*ln by a word make a man out to be an offender, and*ld lay a snare for him who reproves in the gate, and*ld with an empty plea turn aside him who is in the right.
Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob*pn shall no more be ashamed, no*ld more shall his face grow pale.
For*ln when he sees his children, the*ld work of my hands, in his midst, they*ld will sanctify my name; they*ln will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob and*ld will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
And*ln those who go astray in spirit will come to understanding, and*ld those who murmur will accept instruction.”
